description: B.S. in Computer Engineering and Computer Science

relevantCourses.courseName: Design and Analysis of Computer Algorithms
relevantCourses.courseDescription: Analyzed numerous strategies including divide-and-conquer, greedy algorithms and dynamic programming, to determine time complexity and effectiveness in a variety of problems.

Gained an understanding of software development principals and practices including version control, object-oriented programming, software design, documentation, GUI, mobile app development and multithreading.

relevantCourses.courseName: Principles of Information and Data Management
relevantCourses.courseDescription: Presented topics in data management to effectively store and query data from relational databases.
Investigated and implemented a variety of data structures and algorithms to understand application of each in Java.
Utilized C programming to introduce concepts in Unix, memory management, multi-threading, debugging, system calls and more.
Explored software development lifecycle, documentation, system specification, software design patterns and testing through semester-long team project.
Introduced fundamental concepts of artificial intelligence including knowledge representation and reasoning, machine learning, and natural language.
Investigated and implemented Operating System concepts including mutlicore architecture, CPU management, thread synchronization, CPU scheduling and more through C programming.
Gained fundamental understanding in programming concepts including, but not limited to, problem  analysis and  design, object oriented programming, recursion and runtime complexity in Java.
Introductory-level course to programming in MATLAB illustrated through class projects and assignments.
Presented topics on computer architecture to highlight lifecycle of the processor by exploring computer arithmetic hardware, memory hierarchy, microprocessor pipeline and MIPS Assembly Language
